title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Wednesday 6 December 2017 - BBC News
summary: passengers injured as tram comes off its tracks .
crash causing long tail backs across nottingham .
buses report two hour delays on some routes .
nottingham 's university boulevard expected to be shut all evening .
a52 crash : two men cut out of car .
shopping centre firm bought by rival .

documents.title: nhs tracker : check key targets in your area
text: nhs tracker : check key targets in your area

documents.title: tram crash sparks 'worst delays in years '
text: tram crash sparks 'worst delays in years '

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for dedicated live coverage this evening .
traffic in nottingham appears to be easing but automatic travel updates will keep you informed throughout the evening .
you can keep up to date on the latest with the tram crash on our facebook page or on nottingham express transit 's own website .

documents.title: tram crash : recap
text: so , to recap , at about about 14:50 today a tram and a van were involved in a crash on university boulevard , derailing the tram .
passengers described a loud bang and screaming from people who `` feared it would roll over '' .
four people were injured and needed treatment , net said .
since the crash , engineers have been working to put the tram back on its tracks but it has forced the closure of university boulevard in both directions .
the jam has caused severe congestion across the city , with nottingham buses reporting two hour delays and the `` worst traffic in eight years '' .
drivers have been warned to stay off the roads if possible this evening as university boulevard is expected to remain shut .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: tram is 'worst idea for nottingham '
text: strong comments from reg here
tram crash causing 'two hour delays ' on roads
absolutely absurd that there is no plan to get traffic moving in this kind of emergency !
the tram is literally the worst idea for nottingham in my lifetime by a country mile !
absurd that people cant stop at red lights ehh
fair point but to think that nobody anticipated anything like this ever happening and put a plan in place is unbelievable
not someone colliding with it ?
it 's the tram !
how about actually controlling traffic growth .
it does n't seem to be a thing yet in gb as far as i can see .
the point is there should absolutely be a plan in place to prevent the kind of disruption we saw last night in the event of an accident or crash or whatever !
the tram was supposed to help control traffic growth but evidently it has n't worked !
waste of money !
if an accident occurs on the tracks not a lot can be done .
dry telling people not to have accidents .
snow ?
well in some areas of the country people ca n't cope with it .
we in the north laugh at the antics of southern motorists and others who struggle with a tiny snowfall .
what you mean the idiot driving that hit the tram isnt to blame ?
plus we pay a parking levy for this .
should at least be refunded for a month as compensation .
should have been a contingency plan for this type of incident .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: tram crash : 'please avoid ' university boulevard
text: `` please avoid . ''
that 's about right .
this is the current traffic situation outside bbc nottingham at the bottom of london road .
pretty crazy for gone 19:00 on a wednesday evening .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'if you do n't have to travel , do n't bother '
text: weary reporter jack maclaren has just returned to bbc nottingham hq after spending almost four hours stuck in traffic .
`` i left the bbc at 14:45 to go to attenborough - normally a 15 , 20 minute drive .
`` i was travelling down university boulevard and saw everybody doing u-turns - i kept going , wondering what was happening , for another five minutes and then i realised the awful truth .
`` they were just turning everyone back before they got too irate .
eventually i got to attenborough 90 mins after i left .
coming back i thought 'oh it probably wo n't be as bad ' .
i could n't have been more wrong .
it 's taken me just over two hours .
`` i tried an alternative route , using back roads but it did n't work .
it was horrific , i do n't think it would have mattered which way i went .
`` if you do n't have to travel tonight , do n't bother .
it 's horrendous . ''

documents.title: tram crash : uni boulevard 'closed for the evening '
text: university boulevard is still shut both ways between woodside road and clifton boulevard because of that tram derailment and it 's causing major congestion right across the city .
unfortunately it sounds like it will be shut for the rest of the evening .
obviously all the surrounding routes are absolutely solid , in fact clifton boulevard is stationary between the nottingham knight and the qmc .
the a453 is also stationary heading in through clifton from the crusader island and is very slow in the opposite direction .
queen 's drive is absolutely solid both ways as is derby road , trent bridge and loughborough road .
wilford lane in west bridgford is also looking incredibly slow .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: tram crash causing 'two hour delays ' on roads
text: this sums up the travel situation in nottingham
in my 8 years of providing updates , i 've never seen delays on our network as severe as we 're currently experiencing .
our most delayed bus is currently 2 hours 12 minutes behind where it should be .
given the severity of delays , if you do not need to travel , i suggest you do n't .
how long is it taking 78/79 buses from bar lane to get into town ?
up to 40 minutes , buses on those routes are severely delayed .
assuming it 's mainly alfreton road that 's the problem than nuthall road then .
thank you
the city centre has been very congested the last couple of hours too .
thank you for providing a brilliant bus service for nottingham and for keep us updated when things go wrong .
we are privileged to be so well provided for .
thank you very much !
it 's beginning to look a lot like christmas ! ! !
there 's been a serious rtc affecting us tonight .
do you reckon things will be back to normal tomorrow ?
it largely depends on when the derailed tram is recovered and university boulevard re-opens .
how are the 4s & 1s looking ?
severely delayed , i 'm afraid .
ok , thank you
great honesty
thanks to ncc and their hatred of cars
79 not running from rise park towards moor bridge .
bus has been vandalised according to my partner .
the 15 just sailed past my son on a 'temporary stop ' i had warned him to make himself seen , he did , it 's cold , it 's wet , he now has a long walk or a longer wait stupid just before 9pm
blame councillor collins and his car hating friends in @ twitterid and those that back him @ twitterid get rid of them and make them accountable .

i hope that @ twitterid will be involved in discussions with the @ twitterid transport portfolio holder , @ twitterid @ twitterid etc to establish cause & future contingency arrangements in the event of a recurrence ?
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: delays on the a1 after two-vehicle crash
text: just to compound travel misery around nottinghamshire , this crash has closed the a1 between grantham and long bennington .
it 's causing problems on the a52 and the a46 .
# a1 northbound is closed between # a52 # grantham and b6326 # longbennington due to a 2 vehicle collision involving a lorry and car .
@ twitterid are on scene and @ twitterid @ twitterid are towards.diversion : a52 west , a46 north , re-join a1 .
expected to be closed for sevral hours .
sat in the queue .
for those that are beyond the a52 can the police not take people off onto valley lane then fen lane to get back onto the a1 ?
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: lengthy traffic jams caused by tram crash
text: the derailed tram is causing severe congestion around nottingham with commuters complaining of lengthy tailbacks .
the dark red routes on this map give an indication of just how bad it currently is on .
might be worth putting off driving any where .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: tram crash : your comments
text: the crash involving a tram and lorry has got you talking on facebook .
martyn webster said : `` causing travel chaos it is too ! !
glad there 's no serious injuries . ''
pengda li added : `` avoid that area , completely jammed ! ''
deborah abrahall said : `` yep - just taken hour and half to do a 25min journey !
author: Facebook

documents.title: teen rapist searched for 'warped ' videos
text: teen rapist searched for 'warped ' videos

documents.title: four passengers hurt in tram derailment
text: nottingham express transit has confirmed four passengers were injured in the crash between a van and a tram this afternoon .
it happened as the tram was crossing university boulevard near the university of nottingham stop .
`` the tram has become derailed and is currently blocking the junction , '' an net spokesman said .
`` emergency services are on the scene and four passengers have been injured as a result of the impact .
trams from hucknall are turning back at the ng2 tram stop , while toton-bound services are turning at the university boulevard stop .
bus services connecting the university tram stop with nottingham rail station are operating , net added .
the organisation apologised for any inconvenience , adding it will be `` assisting police '' once normal services resume .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tram crash : more from the scene
text: university boulevard remains closed after the tram derailment .
author: Steve Beech
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: watch : workers fail to get derailed tram back on tracks
text: engineers try ( and fail ) to re-rail the tram on university boulevard .
author: Steve Beech
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: engineers work on derailed tram
text: engineers are using hydraulic jacks in an attempt to get the front wheels of the tram back on the line .
author: Steve Beech
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: tram crash : firefighters have left the scene
text: fire crews have now left the scene of the derailed tram .
tram update : our firefighters have now left the incident on # universityboulevard however other agencies remain on scene to deal with the derailed tram .
for further updates , please follow @ twitterid and @ twitterid # oneteam
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: tram crash : passenger in wheelchair 'marooned '
text: firefighters rescued a passenger in a wheelchair who was `` marooned '' on the tram after it collided with a van , the fire service has said .
a nottinghamshire fire and rescue firefighter at the scene said `` [ there was ] always potential it would be quite serious but does n't appear to be so . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tigers ' genge requires shoulder surgery
text: tigers ' genge requires shoulder surgery

documents.title: tram crash : passenger describes 'huge bang '
text: `` all of a sudden there was a huge bang and a scraping noise and the tram veers over a few feet , '' said carole wall , who was on the tram when the crash happened .
`` everyone on the tram was screaming and it ground to a halt .
`` it looked like a white van had crashed into the tram , totally derailed and blocking all four lanes of the boulevard . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fears derailed tram 'would roll over '
text: a woman who was on the derailed nottingham tram has just told me she feared it would roll over .
i saw an elderly passenger being taken off the derailed tram by stretcher after the crash on university boulevard .
author: Steve Beech
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: tram derailed : passengers 'injured '
text: nottinghamshire police were called at 14:50 after a crash involving a tram and a van , a force spokesman said .
the driver of the van is fine but some passengers on the tram have minor injuries like whiplash '' .
university boulevard remains closed in both directions .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

the tram has derailed and the road is closed in both directions .

Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: derailed tram : firefighters on the scene
text: we currently have firefighters from # highfields # londonroad and # westbridgford in attendance at the collision on # universityboulevard .
please avoid the area if possible as the road is currently blocked .
for information on tram services , please follow @ twitterid

thank you for your patience while we deal with this incident alongside @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid

BBC Local Live

documents.title: derailed tram : 'passengers were screaming '
text: carole wall , from beeston , was on the tram which was hit by a van just after it left the university of nottingham tram stop heading out of the city .
she said passengers were screaming and one woman needed medical attention after being knocked to the floor .
author: Steve Beech
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: tram crash : shuttle service for passengers
text: service update : for all passengers travelling between university boulevard and toton lane we are now running a tram shuttle service through all those stops .
where can i catch it from ?
i usually get on the tram at gregory street
university boulevard is the closest stop you would be able to get the shuttle from

yes carl there are extended wait times of up to 10 minutes but trams are running through this section .
what about qmc @ twitterid going towards hucknall
hi claire you would need to catch the 36 bus from the hospital to nottingham and link back up with the tram to hucknall
thanks
thought you would have to road back open by now
we apologise for the delay all of our technicians are there trying to get the road cleared as soon as possible
nearly taking as long as it did to build the tram lines in the first place

thanks !
yes chris the trams are still running from hucknall

hi emily there is no service from qmc you would need use the 36 bus from the front of the hospital .

the orange line number 36 and navy line number 49 buses are accepting tram tickets .
trains are also accepting tickets from beeston to nottingham , net said .
there has been an accident between a van and a tram on university boulevard , and the road is closed .
we are diverting all services down woodside road , priory island & qmc in both directions .
this will cause significant delays as we approach rush hour , so please be aware .

in for a walk it seems
no problem !

hi george yes you are still able to travel towards clifton

so ca n't get from qmc to the city centre ?
trams are still running between toton and beeston
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man jailed for 1970s children 's home abuse
text: a man has been jailed for abusing a boy at a nottinghamshire children 's home more than 40 years ago .
barrie pick , 74 , went on trial at nottingham crown court two weeks ago .
a jury has today found him guilty of abusing a boy at the former beechwood children 's home in the mid-1970s .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester attack : teen chooses not to give evidence
text: a teenager accused of attempting to bludgeon a rape victim to death in an act of `` desolating wickedness '' has opted not to give evidence in his defence .

the 17-year-old claimed through his legal team that he intended to render the victim unconscious , but did not intend to end her life after arming himself with a paving slab in leicester 's victoria park on 3 july .
the teen , who can not be named because of his age , admits rape and causing grievous bodily harm with intent - but denies attempted murder .
the boy 's defence case was concluded in less than a minute by his qc .
in the closing speech , prosecutor gordon aspden claimed the attack was an attempt to `` silence '' the victim .
the jury is expected to retire after the judge 's summing up later today .
author: Press Association

documents.title: listener pledge 's £ 20,000 to help treat sick son
text: a mum from mansfield who is selling wedding dresses to raise £ 80,000 to pay for treatment on her son 's tumour has received a huge boost .
sandra marshall wants specialist stem cell treatment in germany for her son jack who has a brain tumour .
we featured sandra 's story yesterday and it touched listener joy so much she said she 's donating £ 20,000 to the cause .
`` i never knew a mother 's love - what a thing for a mother to come on the radio and ask for help for her son , '' she said .
`` well i was able to help and i 'm really glad i did . ''
joy , who has no children , said she buried her husband last week .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: youngsters ' confidence 'boosted ' through wrestling
text: a community group in chaddesden , derby is helping hundreds of young people boost their confidence through wrestling .
members of aspire wrestling alliance say lives are being changed with many of their students improving their social skills and making friends .
the group 's been awarded children in need funding which will help an additional 150 disadvantaged youngsters get into the ring .
author: Hannah Meredith
Journalist, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: man caught trying to urinate asks for fine to be reduced
text: a drunk derby man who was caught trying to urinate in a doorway in broad daylight in the city centre cheekily asked a judge if there was any way his fine could be reduced .
southern derbyshire magistrates ' court heard how graham wright stood in the derelict doorway in the morledge in full view of people buying food from a neighbouring takeaway .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: arson arrest man released
text: police have said a man arrested after a series of sus fires in loughborough has been released with no further action .
seven reports were received of fires in the town between 19:50 and 22:40 on monday .
the first took place in the middle of belton road , near garages and a petrol station .
bin fires were reported in russell street , mill lane , bridgeland road , wolsey way and morris close and a sofa was set alight in queens road ( causing damage to nearby flats .
one person was taken to hospital with smoke inhalation .
a 20-year-old man was arrested on sus of arson with intent to endanger life but has been released with no further action .
pc pete colgate said : we believe these fires were deliberate and very dangerous acts and could have resulted in someone being seriously injured . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: golf buggy batteries stolen
text: dozens of batteries have been stolen from golf buggies at a nottinghamshire course .
police said several buggies were moved to a secluded part of oakmere golf club in oxton last wednesday night .
a total of 44 batteries were removed from the carts .
police believe some of the buggies were driven around the golf course causing damage .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tree fall car woman takes council to court
text: remember when storm doris battered the country back in february 23 ?
leanne bateman came out of her house in leicester forest east to discover a tree had fallen on her car .
she would have been in the jaguar at the time , she said , but she 'd stayed in to have a cup of tea with her daughter before leaving .
she loved the vehicle because it had been given to her by her mum , she added .
her insurance company has warned she 'll lose her no-claim bonus and face higher insurance payments if she claims , she said .
leanne said she had previously complained about the tree to leicestershire county council , saying it was rotten .
she said it 's caused her great stress and shock and she 's taking the council to a small claims court in january .
a spokesman for the authority said : `` we were sorry to hear of the damage to ms bateman 's car which occurred during a severe storm .
`` as court proceedings are ongoing , we are unable to comment on any legal issues which are specific to this case . ''
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: woman has hysterectomy carried out by a robot
text: a robot has performed a hysterectomy on a nottinghamshire woman .

julie clarkson , 76 , from southwell , became one of the first people to have robot assisted gynaecological surgery at a nottinghamshire hospital when she had her operation on saturday , november 25 .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: robber fended off by pensioner with walking stick
text: a pensioner used his walking stick to fend off a robber who forced his way into his house in crich .
matthew birks was holding what was believed to be a knife when he entered the property in glebe field close in may this year .
the 85-year-old hit birks over the head twice with his stick before he fled empty-handed , derbyshire police said .
officers later charged birks when his fingerprints were found inside the property and traces of his dna were on the walking stick .
the 21-year-old , of market place , crich , was charged with one count of attempted robbery and one of having a bladed article in public .
he pleaded guilty to both charges and was sentenced to three years and eight months in prison at derby crown court last week .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: league of gentlemen trailer released
text: welcome back to royston vasey
the league of gentlemen , filmed in part in hadfield in derbyshire , is returning for three christmas specials on 18 , 19 and 20 december on bbc two .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shopping centre firm to be bought by rival company
text: intu , the company which owns three shopping centres in the east midlands , could be bought out by a rival .
the takeover by hammerson is reported to be worth £ 3.4bn and will see the larger firm running nottingham 's victoria centre , broadmarsh shopping centre and derby 's intu .
hammerson already owns highcross shopping centre in leicester .
the share offer comes as a full planning application is expected for the redevelopment of the broadmarsh centre .
shares in intu rose by 18 % at the start of trading today following the announcement .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: man admits sexual activity with girl , 13
text: man admits sexual activity with girl , 13

documents.title: a52 crash : road re-opens
text: a52 outbound has reopened at rspca after earlier accident.still major tailbacks to gamston a52/a6011 roundabout
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: two men escape serious injury in a52 crash
text: shocking of a crash between a car and a lorry on the a52 at radcliffe-on-trent this morning that 's closed the eastbound side .
the two men who were cut out of the car are being treated in hospital for non life-threatening injuries .
it happened at about 06:30 between the rspca junction at nottingham road and lees barn road , according to nottinghamshire police .
traffic 's still being diverted along stragglethorpe road .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: second camera car to crackdown on dangerous parking
text: a second cctv vehicle could be used to catch more people parking dangerously outside schools in nottinghamshire .
the current camera car has helped issue 900 penalty notices for inconsiderate parking at schools and bus stops between january and september this year .
nottinghamshire county council is now planning to buy a second car .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: spoty 2017 : 'adam peaty is a machine ' says adlington
text: from one east midlands swimming star to another .
double 2008 olympic swimming champion rebecca adlington has been giving her support to adam peaty who 's in the running for bbc sports personality 2017 .
she said she 's `` never known an athlete be so consistent and so dominant '' as the 22-year-old former city of derby swimmer , who now trains at loughborough .
`` adam is just so special in every single way .
you ca n't replicate adam .
he 's created a new mould that everyone wants to copy , '' said the mansfield swimmer .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'hero ' biker aiming for classroom return
text: 'hero ' biker aiming for classroom return

documents.title: concerns over newark train service
text: there are calls for significant investment to improve rail services in newark - following the announcement of a rise in ticket prices .
the average ticket price will go up by 3.4 % in january .
more trains were added on the route serving nottingham and lincoln in 2015 after a long running campaign led by newark business club.t
these passengers say the route can be over crowded at times .
east midlands trains said it is currently using its entire rolling stock .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: teenager assaulted in alvaston
text: a 15-year-old boy was taken to hospital following an assault in alvaston .
he was riding along the alleyway towards the canal path near avonmouth drive when he passed a group of youths yesterday at about 18:00 .
derbyshire police said the boy felt a blow to his back and thought he had been punched but he later realised he had been cut .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: a mild start to the day but could turn wet and windy later .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: foxes field £ 45m under-21 side in scunthorpe win
text: leicester city fielded an under-21 side with six over-age players , three internationals and transfer fees worth around £ 45m in their 2-1 checkatrade trophy second-round win at scunthorpe .
kelechi iheanacho ( joined leicester from manchester city for £ 25m this summer - more than 50 times the record fee paid by opponents scunthorpe united .
the nigerian started up front alongside leonardo ulloa as city edged past the league one side .
two youngsters - george thomas and sam hughes - put the foxes into an early lead .
kevin van veen pulled one back for the iron just before the break , although just 824 fans were there to see it .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel : latest on east midlands roads
text: travel : latest on east midlands roads
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: delays on busy road after crash
text: worth noting if you are heading in this direction .
we have been informed of an accident at the rspca outbound from nottingham and the police have closed the road .
this means likely delays for # mainline , so please bear with us
how long are the delays ?
been waiting 30 minutes for the cotgrave connection to turn up .
thanks
it looks worse than we thought , and they all seem to be stuck one way or the other near the accident , iain .
not sure how long they will take to be perfectly honest , depends on how the traffic is controlled ~ste
any further update ?
only that we are seeing delays of over an hour , and it shows no sign of improving .
unfortunately it looks quite serious , and we may see delays for quite a while ~ste
# a52 eastbound we are getting reports of a collision on the approach to the # a46 # radcliffe junction near # nottingham .
please allow extra time if heading this way .
we will keep you updated once we know more
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
dave wade and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebookor twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News
